result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 4, 2023 at 10:00 am.

2:05 PM Defendant Kyle E. Berschneider in court, in custody.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared by video for Kyle E. Berschneider. Court calls case and appearances. Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.

1:00 PM Defendant Kyle E. Berschneider appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Christian Ness in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gabe Pollak and Intern Connor Hanson appeared by video for Kyle E. Berschneider. Court calls case and appearances. Court reviews file. Court questions the non-appearance by defendant. Mr. Hanson speaks to the court. Court speaks to the parties. Court questions the defendant. State makes bond argument-requesting a $2500 cash bond. Mr. Hanson makes bond argument to the court-requesting a signature bond. Court sets bond.
Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:55 pm.
